references.paper_title: Fully convolutional networks for semantic segmentation
references.reason: This paper is foundational for semantic segmentation, introducing the fully convolutional network architecture that many later methods build upon.
This paper introduces the Segment Anything Model (SAM), a foundational model that the current paper extends for few-shot semantic segmentation.

references.paper_title: Semantic image segmentation with deep convolutional nets and fully connected crfs
references.reason: This paper is a highly influential early work in semantic segmentation that uses deep convolutional networks and fully connected CRFs.

references.paper_title: Deeplab: Semantic image segmentation with deep convolutional nets, atrous convolution, and fully connected crfs
references.reason: This is another highly influential work from the DeepLab series that incorporates atrous convolutions for better semantic segmentation performance.

references.paper_title: Dinov2: Learning robust visual features without supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces DINOv2, a self-supervised vision backbone that the current paper uses for its feature extraction, and is important because of its strong performance.
